messages.message: hey i just noticed in training-utils we added about ~100MB of image data to GitHub? Any chance we could not store many large images in the codebase itself, maybe use S3?
if it’s got to be in the repo, you could use Git LFS as well (https://git-lfs.github.com/)
although, pricing can be confusing for that

this sounds like the model we added for east for emerson. @Divya is working on moving it to s3 already, but not sure if we’ll be able to delete it from git history. is the general convention to just leave it in history?
I think the images added today were from the image distressing pipeline that @Loc built-- the emerson model will be moved to s3 shortly
gotcha @Loc perhaps you and @Divya can take the same approach in using either S3 or Git LFS for storing data that can be referenced via S3 links to our GitHub?
